properties.title: Usage tour: Creating a document type and template

section.name: Creating a document type and template
section.p: It is possible to create your own document types. Using the workflow steps that are used, we'll create one.

subsection.name: Create a Namespace
subsection.p: Select the Browse tab and navigate to "document types". Click the "create namespace" link and enter a prefix and a URL.

The URL defines a globally unique address. It is not resolved, i.e. it is not necessary that opening the link in a browser will show anything. The best practice is to pick a domain under your control.

subsection.name: Create a new Type
subsection.p: Select the example namespace and follow the "Create new type" link. Enter a name for the type that you're about to create.

subsection.name: Edit Model
subsection.p:
It is now possible to customize the type. Select the newly created type and click "edit model" under the Actions. Initially no fields are present, but you can add those in the editor.
Click "String" to add a string property to the document model
Click the edit icon next to the String field that appears
Change the path to "example:title"
Change the Caption to "Title"
Press "save"
Click "Html" and the edit icon

subsection.name: Update Content
subsection.p: The edited model can not be used yet. At the moment it is only known to the CMS, but no node type has actually been defined yet. So it is not yet possible to create new documents of this type. Bear with me, you'll soon be able to do this.
Save the model and go back to the Browse tab. Select the namespace that you created (say, "example"). There is an "Update content" link under the list of available actions.
You're now able to create folders that can contain the new type.
